page.title: 12HIGH ERCALL CHURCH
page.content: High Ercall Church is at the end of Church Road. It is quite near to the school. It was built in 1090 and it was restored in 1864_65 after the Civil war. West of the Church there are remains of High Ercall Hall. There is a gritty, stoney path leading to the door. The tower is supported by buttresses to stop the tower falling apart. On the edge of the tower there are gargoyles. On the top of the bell tower there are battlements. That is unusual for a Church,because Churches are temples of God. In the Civil War the bell tower was knocked down by a cannon ball. The stone blocks are made out of sandstone. There are three clocks. Most of the windows are arched with little bars across. Some of the windows are slatted. By Matthew Lowe
